column4: My nvidia-settings is lacking 1600x1200, how can i specify it?
gksudo nvidia-settings           write the X config file, then edit the file manually to set the resolution you want
I'll try that
its old school but works

Also, the settings state that my NVidia 8400 card has 512MB of memory and that my onboard NVidia 8300 is using 512MB (taking some of my ram). Is it benefiting me that the onboard has VRAM? If not, how to i stop it from taking my RAM?
if you only want 1 dispay, disable the onboard.
well my motherboard supports hybrid SLI so they could very well be working together. I just want to know if they are in ubuntu, or if disabling the onboard would be better.
well if you need the ram and the cad uses the system ram, disable it
amount of ram isn't really an issue, i just more want to find out if the onboard is doing anything
disable it and bootup, see what happens. You can always reboot and re-enable it
couldn't get your advice to work
no matter what i do to xorg.conf nothing changes
so you wrote the X config to the xorg.conf file, you will see resolutions in the screen section. Change them to what you desire and restart the x server
i did so, in fact i even tried copying the line of resolutions from the backup of my 8.04
no change at all
i'm starting to think xorg.conf doesn't do anything LOL
I'll try using the entire xorg.conf i used on 8.04 and see if it does anything at all
going to reboot to see if it works, let me know if you think of anything else when i get back if you will XD
first attempt at the failed but i changed the @s to _s in the resolutions and it works perfect now
awesome
backup the file now :)
then if you reinstall you can simply install the driver then drop the good file in
was all you duder, i only pointed the right way
